trial_identification.studytitle: A randomised phase III trial evaluating the efficacy of more intensive written information in patients having radical radiation therapy.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A prospective randomised phase III trial evaluating the effect of more intensive information on patient satisfaction and anxiety.

interventions.interventions: The intervention is intensive written information and an extra nursing consultation.The written information outlines radiotherapy details and toxicity.Lifestyle issues such as diet,exercise,smoking and pratical issues such as parking and treatment costs.The control arm has a standard consultation.The intervention/control is for the duration of radiation treatment varying from 5-7 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The primary outcome is anxiety scores
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured initially (prior to intervention) and following the intervention at 2 intervals (pre and post radiotherapy).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The secondary outcome is patient satisfaction.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This is measured following the intervention and prior to commencing radiotherapy.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: The patient must be having radical radiotherapy.The patient must have a good understanding of english.The patient must be able to complete questionnaire unaided.Used only for patients diagnosed with Breast,Lung,Prostate,Rectal and Gynaecological cancer.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: A poor understanding of written english.Significant visual impairment and previous radiation therapy.

trial_design.concealment: Both arms given information envelope.Numbered sealed envelopes where sequence was conceaed until interventions were assigned.
trial_design.sequence: Random number. Random allocation sequence is attended to by coin toss and blocking.
